intro: Eschweilera pseudodecolorans, commonly known as the pink-veined tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with distinctive pink veins. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pink, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically important species.
